Name: priZon
Title: Serene
Review: Built 1783Situated amid hustle bustle of chandni chowk &  old delhi. Pious n serene. Must visit if nearby. First visited 1995Next feb 2013

Name: A Choudhury
Title: Divine and Peaceful
Review: This is a must visit place if you are in Chandni Chowk area. Located very near to the Red Fort, the place is well maintained and beautiful. Once inside, you will feel inner peace and calmness.

Name: SAROJ8585
Title: THE HOLY GURUDWARA
Review: Gurudwara sisganj sahib is one of the nine historical gurudwaras in Delhi.It is situated in Chandni chowk in old Delhi.It was built at the spot where Guru Tegbahadur was beheaded by mughal emperor Aurangzeb.This gurudwara is built in sikh architecture.

Name: PhilthetravellerXI
Title: Beautiful Sikh Temple
Review: This lovely temple is in the midst of Old Delhi and a historic site, the martyrdom of the ninth Sikh Guru (dating back to 1675). It gives one some exposure to the Sikh religion and for me as a westerner was a great experience. A very nice old building (built in 1783), you enter in bare feet and wash your feet prior entry, the music, the reverence of the interior, the colours and the music and chants are quite amazing. It is indeed a special place. It is worth reading about the Temple before your visit (we sadly had not done that but have since done so and relived the visit reviewing the many photos taken). We now know a lot more about the history and philosophy behind the Sikh religion and way of life. It is also important to visit the kitchens and see where the huge amounts of fresh food are prepared – vegetables and breads, to feed the poor. A very worthwhile visit and a unique insight into a major part of Indian culture.

Name: Reetika Khanijou
Title: A spiritual venue amidst the chaos of Chandni Chowk
Review: Before coming here, it is best to learn of the history behind it. Because after you do, and when you arrive..everything seems surreal. Sacrifices made calls upon faith.

Name: good-living-montreal
Title: A practicing Sikh temple - immerse yourself with spiritual experience!
Review: Right in the bustling and busy Chandni Chowk market, this temple is an active Sikh worship place. Take off your shoes, deposit them in the storage room in the basement and go up to the 1st floor where you are greeted by chanting and music and prayers.

Name: Love to Travel
Title: Sikh temple
Review: It's nice that anyone can enter as long as you cover your head. Sit crossed legged on the floor making sure not to display the soles of you feet toward the front and enjoy the chanting.Afterwards visit the kitchens where people of the community, and you if you wish, prepare food for whoever wants to come and enjoy it. The the food is donated as is the time of the people preparing it.

Name: RakeshPratapSingh
Title: Salute
Review: A serene Gurudwara...an oasis of peace in the midst of maddening & chaotic Chandni Chowk area of Old Delhi. This place of worship is the site where the great Guru Tegh Bahadur, the Ninth Sikh Guru was martyred,,,,Wahe Guru

Name: Vijay Hazari
Title: Beautiful gurudwara on the busy roads Chandni Chowk
Review: Gurdwara Sis Ganj Sahib is one of the nine historical Gurdwaras in Delhi. Situated in Chandni Chowk in Old Delhi. This is the place where the ninth Sikh Guru was beheaded on the orders of the Mughal emperor Aurangzeb for refusing to convert to Islam. Historical Monument built to commemorate the extreme sacrifice by Ninth Sikh Guru.Located in main market road which is very crowded and busy place, expectedly inside the Gurdwara is very peaceful. Inside of this holy Gurudwara a very beautiful sanctum. Divine place for inner peace, best to visit early morning. We had visited there 6 am in the morning. If you are in Chandni chowk, then this Gurdwara is a must visit place. If you are in this Gurdwara, then Langar is a must have at this place.If you are in this Gurdwara, then one must sit and listen to music of Gurbani which is very soothing.If you are in this Gurdwara, then its recommended few minutes of meditation for inner peace. Gurdwara is near to Chandni Chowk Metro station.

Name: theartisans
Title: Amazing selflessness
Review: Gurudwara supported by the local Sikh community. Feeds over 10k people per day (over 30k on weekends) , no matter class, social standing or religion. Open 24/7, 365The temple is well attended and in honour of the 9th Sikh Guru that was beheaded on this site.Amazing cultural experience. We hVe a lot to learn...

Name: Harshit
Title: Devotional
Review: This gurudwara is situated near chandni chowk. People can accomodate here at a very low price. Food served is delicious.

Name: Annie
Title: Guru ke dwar
Review: A gurdwara in the middle of Chandni Chowk.Most spiritual place to visit when you are in need of peice.I have visited this place only once.

Name: 792Carol_H
Title: Wonderful
Review: We have never been into a Sikh temple and found it very interesting. We actually visited the temple as part of a food tour. We had to remove shoes, wear something on our heads, wash our hands, walk through water to wash our feet and sit down on the floor and listen to I guess what you could call either prayers or meditation. We walked around the temple through the kitchen and a dining hall, where the temple feeds roughly 20,000 people for lunch and dinner every day. Anyone can eat there rich, poor and even tourists if they wish. It was quite interesting listening to our guide explain about the Sikh religion.Gurdwara Sis Ganj Sahib is one of the nine historical Gurdwaras in Delhi. It was first constructed in 1783 by Baghel Singh Dhaliwal to commemorate the martyrdom site of the ninth Sikh Guru, Guru Tegh Bahadur. It marks the site where the ninth Sikh Guru was beheaded on the orders of the Mughal emperor Aurangzeb on 11 November 1675 for refusing to convert to Islam.Very intetesting and a must do.

Name: Sushen K
Title: Spiritual place to visit
Review: It is a best spiritual place to visit in Chandni Chownk . here you will get know about the Sikh religion

Name: drarunkumar24
Title: Tranquility
Review: Chandni Chowk is one of the busiest markets in Delhi, it is historical and has many worthwhile sights around. After experiencing all that there is on offer you want a few moments of quiet and reflection go to this beautiful 18th Century Gurudwara situated in the heart of Chandni Chowk to pause,reflect and regain your equanimity.

Name: Anurag Saurabh
Title: My visit to this holy place
Review: I was a regular visitor and Chandani Chowk and this place is in the middle of that locality. In the midst of a very crowded and busy place, you will find something very peaceful. Inside of this holy Gurudwara a very beautiful sanctum. Food is getting offered to everybody all day. Love this place.

Name: Daniel Westfield
Title: Amazing Holy Visit !
Review: Visiting this temple was Truly a magical. We were in new Delhi and Decided to have a Walk at this Place. But Believe Me this Place is More than Awesome. This was probably one of the most impacting experiences we had in our whole trip in North India. As with all Gurudwaras, this Holy and Historical place of Worship Welcomes people of all Faiths, so much so, that at times you are not sure that it is even Sikh temple due to so many tourists from South India. It's a huge Sikh temple, famous for their volunteer activity to feed large number of people a day for free. Difficult to explain this experience, we were awed by it, the size of the "kitchen", with all volunteers preparing food, and all volunteers distributing food for a roomful of New Delhi folks. If you're so inclined, you can help with the Food Preparation. Amazing experience. I would love to visit Again.

Name: Sandeep S
Title: Awesome
Review: Divine Place, we had visited there 4am in the morning, even that time there were lot of people. Its a historical Gurudwara.

Name: Edin Krnic
Title: Peaceful
Review: This is really nice, scary and peaceful temple. Really recommend to all tourists to visit this beautiful templé

Name: Amar singh rawat
Title: Must visit place
Review: Must visit place. Situated in chandni chowk.Spend some time inside gurudwara.. U find the calmness within.. Peace... Take lunch sitting on the floor.. Served with dedicated self support staff.

Name: A R Kohli
Title: A beautiful and Historical Gurudwara
Review: This is the Historical Monument built to commemorate the extreme sacrifice by Ninth Guru Satguru Tegh Bahadur.  You will experience peace and tranquility and enjoy Langar also.Governor Amolak Rattan Kohli

Name: andria
Title: peaceful
Review: We visited Gurudwara Sis Ganj as part of our tour on a weekday morning. Although the temple was pretty packed, everyone was kind with us and even tried to explained us stuff. We also visited their kitchen and helped to make some rotis which was a great experience. Overall it is a great place to get educated about the Sikh religion but also experience their philanthropy.

Name: Reyan11
Title: Historical & Sacred Place
Review: Constructed to commemorate 9th Sikh guru. Food provided free to needy ones. Peaceful place to visit.

Name: Jack S
Title: Great place to see in the capital
Review: A nice place to visit, however we did not receive much information about the Gurdwara (thanks to our poor tour guide) so this made the visit less enjoyable. However with the suitable guiding, much more enjoyment from our visit could have been obtained. Nonetheless stunning to see!

Name: Sightsee814346
Title: Place where we can find peace of mind
Review: It is a great belief, that one can find peace of mind visiting this holy place. I have experienced the same. I visit here once a week as my routine. It has great story of sacrifice

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: Cultural experience
Review: Nice place to go here and they serve poor for free everyday with food.Clean and calm inside.Parking is available and shoe racks are present here as well

Name: Dalbir_S_Virdi
Title: Holy Place of Shri Guru Tegh Bahadur's Martyrdom
Review: Gurudwara Shri Sheesh Ganj Sahib is one of the oldest Historical Gurudwaras (Sikh Temple) in old Delhi's Chandni Chowk Area. 9th Guru of Sikhs, Shri Guru Tegh Bahadur Ji was beheaded here in the Chowk (Middle of the Market area) by Mughal Emperor Auranghzeb as the Guru refused to accept Islam. This sacrifise saved thousands of Kashmiri Pandits who were being forced to change their releigion from Hinduism to Islam. Its a multi Story Gurudwara with the main hall on the first floor. There is a Guest House (Sarai) and Langar Sewa available next to the Gurudwara Sahib.

Name: Jaspreet Singh
Title: waheguru
Review: whenever i visit delhi i never forget to put my attendance over there.  its so peaceful and spiritual place with peace of mind.  a bit rushy road but its always peaceful

Name: nokidsvacation
Title: Fantastic
Review: I ate at the temple.  Also got to go to community kitchen and roll rotis with my kids. A tourist for foreigners explained in English a little about Sikhism.  Mesmorizing.

Name: Hitesh
Title: Peace... Like all other Gurudwaras...
Review: We came here after visiting Jama Masjid and totally loved the experience. Place has some kind of serenity inside which does gives you peace of mind. The prasada which you get in Gurudwara too is very tasty.

Name: TYPSUKR
Title: Unique Experience of Sikhism
Review: This is a temple, not a tourist attraction, so you will need to treat it respectfully (e.g. observing customs relating to the removal of shoes, the use of head-scarves, etc). However, it is an inviting place, and within all were welcoming, and I was able to learn about Sikhism, both its religious tenets, as well as its role in the community (e.g. the communal feeding). Before entering, you may want to read up a bit on Sikhism, but don't let that deter you from checking it out either.

Name: Sudipta Shaheen
Title: Holy Place
Review: This is great place. This is a Holy place and visiting this place will give you peace of mind. Everybody should visit this place. Arrangment inside is very good as like other gurudwara.. Must visit with family.

Name: Phillip8789
Title: Will Never Forget This Experience
Review: This Sikh place of worship is built at the site where the ninth Guru, Tegh Bahadur was beheaded for refusing to convert to Islam. Its historical significance is not lost on you as you walk its interior and the outdoor area.To witness the many volunteers preparing food for anyone who wishes to avail themselves of the opportunity of a meal (apparently there are thousands that do so per day), irrespective of one's race, colour, wealth or social status, was humbling.Make sure during your time in Delhi that you visit Gurudwara Sis Ganj Sahib - it is an unforgettable experience.

Name: BurzinH
Title: Eternity
Review: When you walk down from Red Fort towards Gali Parathe wali it is on your left hand side at the cross roads.

Name: evilalta
Title: Awesome experience
Review: This was probably one of the most impacting experiences we had in our whole trip in North India. It's a huge Sij temple, famous for their volunteer activity to feed as many as 3000 people a day for free. Difficult to explain this experience, we were awed by it, the size of the "kitchen", with all volunteers preparing food, and all volunteers distributing food for a roomful of New Delhi folks. If you're so inclined, you can help with the food preparation. Amazing experience.

Name: Harman1baaz
Title: All are welcome
Review: Gurudwara SIS GANJ SAHIB is located just before chandni chowk market, and a must visit when ever you are in the area,As with all Gurudwaras, this holy and historical place of worship welcomes people of all faiths, so much so, that at times you are not sure that it is even SIKH temple due to so many tourists from South India.This place has a huge reverence and historical significance, ask any sikh and he will tell in detail

Name: RichTiss
Title: Solemn
Review: It was a very solemn for us seven Australians to visit a Gurudwara and learn about another religion. We were particularly amazed at the volunteers working in the kitchen to provide free food to anyone  that walks in.

Name: Amritpal Singh Kohli
Title: The place of Martyrdom & Sacrifice
Review: Gurudwara Sis Ganj Sahib represents the Martyrdom & sacrifice of the 9the Guru of the Sikhs Shri Guru Reg Bahadur Sahib who sacrificed his own life to theater away the religious oprrdsion of Aurangzeb. This place reminds us of the huge sacrifices made by the Sikhs for this motherland.

Name: mittal2301
Title: Very nice
Review: It is a nice place to visit. You can have everything essential which you need for everyday. . You can consider visiting this place both in family and privacy.

Name: seeker_here
Title: Holy Shrine
Review: Gurudwara Sis Ganj Sahib is the place where Guru Teg Bahadur sacrificed his life and was beheaded by the Mughals. It is a holy shrine.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: Where Ninth Guru gave his sacrifice
Review: A highly revered Gurudwara built at the place where Nineth Guru Teg Bahadurji gave his life by getting beheaded by Mughal King to protect Kashmiri Pandit. Must see place.Governor Amolak Rattan Kohli

Name: Nins
Title: Mesmerizing - During Guru Nanak Jayanti
Review: This Gurudwara is located in Chandni Chowk. We happened to visit this place during the zest of Guru Nanak Jayanti. And yes its is one of the exquisite Gurudwara we have visited. The charm of this place was mesmerizing as it was completely lit. We visited this place again in December and it appeared different without lights. But with lights it was just like a bride.Wash your feet, keep your footwear outside, cover your head (male and female both), have decent clothes on, If you do not have chunri, no issues there are baskets which has chunris for temporary use there and handover.It’s always good to learn about different culture and respect different religion. Many people from different religion visits and could see respecting the culture followed. It’s a very peaceful place. People were lighting candle in one area outside the Gurudwara.One must visit this place.

Name: Sumant S
Title: Holy place
Review: Gurudwara is located on the main road and easily assessable..Nicely managed and maintained..Sat and listened to the shaabd kirtan and it gave immense peace..Located below the main Takth is the place martyr place of guru..

Name: Ismail
Title: Gurudwara
Review: Makes you realize that we are all equal, no race, religion, caste, wealth is acknowledged, only your humanness

Name: Felicity P
Title: Lovely Temple.
Review: A lush, rich spiritual experience. I got to see the kitchens and volunteer army preparing the meals for the masses. Fascinating.

Name: jayeshb08
Title: Gurudrwara at Chandni Chowk
Review: This Gurudrawa is located on the main lane of Chandni chowk and it is really beautiful and peaceful.

Name: Anu789
Title: Historical Gurudwara
Review: Best to reach by public transport. If you are planning to bring your own car, arrive after 9 - by which time the markets have closed and you would be able to find parking easily.

Name: Emily B
Title: Lovely Gurudwara
Review: A nice gurudwara, but not the nicest in Delhi. However, it is centrally located in old delhi and close to other sights, so probably worth going to if you're in the area and want to see. Everyone is welcome and the welcome is really felt! Shoes can be kept for free, in the rooms to the right and underneath the building. Entrance is free as this is a holy building.

Name: akashdhiman
Title: Historical Gurudwara !!
Review: The feeling is different, you start imagining how the great Guru sacrificed and gave his head for saving the people of India against Aurangzeb. Must visit if you are visiting Chandni Chowk ! After this visit you can goto Gali Paranthe Wali and other historical and important places in Chandni Chowk which are just walking distance. !

Name: Shoeb
Title: Nice Place
Review: Amidst all the chaos of Chandni chowk lies this gurudwara Sis Ganj Sahib. Once you reach inside, the atmosphere is very peaceful and you feel very relaxed. Visited this Gurudwara many times during my several visits and always felt very happy and contended.

Name: KapilDwivedi
Title: I like the place a lot.
Review: Everytime i visit delhi i make sure to spend sometime here. Very beautiful place with peace and best is to sit inside the gurudwara and feel the god. amazing.

Name: jmodi1981
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: This is another good place to visit near Chandni Chowk. you can really see some old history here about Sahib.

Name: Abhishek Mittal
Title: Memorable visit after shopping at chandni chowk market
Review: Sis Ganj Sahib Gurudwara is one of the famous spiritual places. It is situated in the middle of the Chandni Chowk market. when u enter to the place then u will feel an amazing sensation in your body which will always be remembered. the nearest metro to the gurudwara is Chandni Chowk metro station and red fort metro station.

Name: Pradeep A
Title: Guru ka Dwar
Review: One of the best sikh gurudwara in Delhi in memory of sikh guru who was matrayed here. Vert peaceful and unique place. It gives inner satisfaction after listening guruwani in shrine. Langar is served during day and night.

Name: Ritu K
Title: Peaceful
Review: It is a Sikh temple.  Please cover your head at all times and remove your shoes before entering this sacred place.

Name: Culture827158
Title: Very Famous Gurudwara
Review: We visited this Gurudwara many times. Its very near to Red fort and Chandni Chowk. you can go to this place via metro..nearest metro station is chandni chowk.

Name: Graciela G
Title: All forts in India are wonderful
Review: This building was an importan fortification for defensive motives, and as other similar buildings like Amer's fort in Jaipur, and Jodhpur, and Jainsalmer's  are similar, wonderful architecture

Name: SandeepSaha1967
Title: A silent prayer of gratitude to the Guru who sacrificed his life, a must visit place for locals and tourists
Review: This is the place of martyrdom of Guru Tegh Bahadur, the ninth Guru of Sikh tradition. Here he was incarcerated, here he took bath with water of a well, read the scriptures and laid down his life to protest forced religious conversions.That was in 1675. Today, thousands come pay their homage in the grand, gold-domed gurudwara where the holy scripture is sang round the clock, water from the well shared and free meals served. Escape the maddening crowd of Chandni Chowk, sit down to listen to the Sabad and partake of the holy water and kada prasad. It costs nothing but your soul would be much richer.

Name: itchyfeet2014
Title: Amazing, not to be missed!
Review: We visited this Sikh temple today as part of a tour. It was amazing from beginning to end. As we changed from our shoes to bare feet, sikhs were eagerly waiting to have their photos taken with us. They were charming and good fun. The temple was beautiful with live music. The kitchen are was part of our visit. Overwhelming to think they feed 10,000 people a day. We joined in making chapatis with the volunteers. Thank you for a great visit.

Name: Angad Singh
Title: Nice Place
Review: This is a historic gurudwara right in the middle of Chandini Chowk. A must visit if you want to get a glimpse into the Sikh religion.

Name: Christine W
Title: Peaceful and calm
Review: This is a Sikh Temple. Outside it is a very busy street and lots of noise , but after leaving your shoes at the lockers and enter, it is very peaceful and calm. The interior is very beautiful. It is good to just sit on the rugs and listen to the music, taking it all in.   We went out the other entrance where we could see the large food hall and the food preparation,we were invited to assist making chapati. The place is worked by volunteers. I felt very privileged

Name: nikkiprincess005
Title: Satnam Vaheguru
Review: Popular and known in chandani chowk area. Heart of the city and around places have many to visit. Gurudwara is a beauty.

Name: nkadagarwal
Title: Good and famous Gurudwara
Review: This is one of the famous gurudwara. This gurudwara is in chandani chowk main market. Langer of gurudwara is too good. One of the famous holy place.

Name: Ashish S
Title: Relegious visit to the Gurudwara
Review: It was a nice visit to Giruduwara Sis Ganj Sahib. The place has got parking even though it's located in Chandni Chowk area.

Name: advance1984
Title: Famous Gurudwara
Review: This is one of the most visited and famous gurudwara. Langer of Gurudwara is very good. Gurudwara is very old.

Name: MandyBrd
Title: Dhan Shri Guru Tegh Bhadur Sahib Ji Mahraaj
Review: I dont think anyone is capable of reviewing n rating the place of god. Sis Ganjh Sahib Gurudwara is a beautiful place with serene and pure vibes. Guru ki bani is the food for thoughts followed by the yummy halwa prashad. Amazing weather n awesome sangat. The pond filled with fishes. One of the most memorable n beautiful part was the ppl who were serving the sangat; were so pious n spiritual.  Their was one old uncle he was completely engrossed in his prayers.  While making us drink water he was reciting wahe guru, wahe guru n for me it is a  blessing pouring with every drop of water...what else i or anybody can ask for. It was indeed a beautiful place.

Name: MilindSurve
Title: Peaceful Place
Review: We been there at around 8 PM in the night, beautiful place it is close distance from Chandani chowk metro station, Red fort.

Name: AnkitJain1368
Title: Symbol of sacrifice
Review: Situated in Chandni Chowk, It speaks of the supreme sacrifice for Religion by Guru Teg Bahadar. Symbol of pride and sacred place of worship.

Name: Mukesh S
Title: Most attractive place in crowded Chandni chowk
Review: Loved this place which looked so mesmirizng with its lighting around - provided a spectacular view and found it was most peaceful place where devotees were also offered with prasad. It was clean and well maintained Gurudwara and loved it. A nice place to see and enjoy the serenity

Name: Jalal Iqbal
Title: nice place
Review: located in chandni shawk. very easy to find and good to visit. ne of the oldest in delhi. ppl r nice and kind. clean and well maintained. worth to stop by and see it. a religious place so show respect and wear proper dress.

Name: nipun2016
Title: A Historical place of worship
Review: 'Gurdwara Sis Ganj Sahib' this place is one of the historical Gurdwaras in Delhi. It was first constructed in 1783 by Baghel Singh to commemorate the martyrdom site of the ninth Sikh Guru, Guru Tegh Bahadur

Name: sainisps197350
Title: Wahe Guru
Review: Gurdwara Sis Ganj Sahib is one of the historical Gurdwaras in Delhi. It was constructed in 1783 by Baghel Singh at the martyrdom site of the ninth Sikh Guru, Guru Tegh Bahadur ji . It's located in the Chandni Chowk . This place is easily accessible with Metro . .

Name: Shaf B
Title: Historical and Holy Place
Review: This is one of the ninth Patshahi gurudwara in the old delhi. Is it located in Chandni Chowk and easily accessible.

Name: wheelzonrent
Title: Holy place in old delhi
Review: It is nice to visit holy places for our peace. This Gurudwara belongs to 9th Sikh Guru.Named as Guru Tegh Bahadur Sahib

Name: Chandan P
Title: Visit this place to feel holyness
Review: A very religious place where your mind get relaxed and a very awesome feeling and get your body calm in this holy place."Serving people is to serve God".

Name: Suneel_12
Title: Blessed
Review: The gurudwara is located in chandni chowk, around 250m walk from red fort, usually too crowded. Blessed with the darshan.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: History of Sacrifice
Review: This Religious Reverd place is symbol of sacrifice to protect the weak against oppressors. People throng in large numbers and get motivated to fight injustice .Governor Amolak Rattan Kohli

Name: emma l
Title: stunning
Review: We visited a few religious sites in Delhi and this was by far the most welcoming, we were lucky enough to attend during a service

Name: meetpetef
Title: Lucky to be here
Review: If you are Sikh or just have an interest in religions this is MUST SEE.  It is one of the nine Gurdwaras of Delhi.  You must walk in barefoot and must have your head covered (male or female).  You can see and feel the passion people have in this very religious building. The ninth Sikh Guru, Guru Tegh Bahadur was beheaded here on 11 November 1675 on the orders of Mughal Emperor Aurangzeb when Guru Tegh Bahadur protested against the forceful conversion of Kashmiri Pandits and non-Muslims to Islam.

Name: manjeet p
Title: SAt Shri Akal
Review: Gurudwara Sis Ganj Sahib is the place where i feels very good, very holy place in delhi, you must visit and Langar jaroor chakhna. Jai Baba ji .........................................................................

Name: Öscar R
Title: very sacred place
Review: During my visit I saw him from the outside because he considers it a matter of respect not to enter the place, but it shows a lot of peace, a lot of devotion on the part of the people who enter the temple, the truth is very nice, the street where the temple is very busy, you have it close to RED FORT, so you could visit it without problems, you can walk down the street and I really denote that it is not dangerous when I walk it

Name: Anitraveller
Title: Worship place
Review: This gurdwara is in Chandi Chowk, very close from old Delhi metro station. It's an ancient gurdware with associated history. One must visit this place if u r visiting Delhi

Name: sethivikram
Title: The best holy place in delhi .
Review: The gurudwara sees ganj is located in chandni chonk.This is the best holy place of sikhism. Vry good management with helping staff. Langer facility ( free food service) also avaliable. Rooms for tourists   also avaliable. Inside the gurudwara sahib u can get the peace of mind and here you feel your soul meet with god..

Name: gauravtandon4ever
Title: Calm, soothing experience
Review: Visit the Gurudwara for a peace of mind, sit and spend some time to listen to the Gurbani and relax yourself. The vicinity is crowded but a visit to the Guru's abode is relaxing

Name: 9708372852a
Title: The Gurudwara with its memory and beautiful
Review: This is the best Gurudwara I have ever visited in my life. Nice management and it was full of clean and neat.

Name: Sargun S
Title: Gurudwara Sis Ganj Sahin
Review: If you are visiting Delhi you should go to this historical mark as it beautifuly made in centre of Chandni Chowk.

Name: Simon
Title: Amazing temple and insight into Sikhism
Review: Visited this temple as part of a guided tour. You have to take your shoes off and give them in at a counter (safe) then put a head cover on which they give you at the door. Amazing calm and cool temple inside to sit and listen to the music/prayers. The temple makes 1500 free meals a day for the people of Delhi - amazing! You can visit the kitchens they prepare the food in too - leave a donation on the way out. Worth a visit.

Name: Kru500
Title: A must for those interested in Sikh history
Review: The brutal murder of the Sikh 9th Guru, Guru Tegh Bahadur, commemorated beautifully by the construction of this Sikh Gurdwara.  Despite the bustle and tangeable sorrow there is a serenity that is all encompassing.  It's humbling beyond words. In my view an absolute must for those wanting to learn more about Sikh history and Sikhism itself.

Name: Jeevika S
Title: Old is gold
Review: Located near the chandi chowk metro station is visited by a lot of people especially from old Delhi .One can visit it any time. It huge a welcomes all.Parking is available a distace but i would not suggest you to take the car because he are ais little conjusted..

Name: Mickyboss
Title: History Detailed To Its Finest ... !!!
Review: So Much Of History Of The Sikhs That Transpired Here , Its Just Wonderful To Experience The Belief & Faith...!!!Must Experience ...!!!

Name: PARIVRAAJK
Title: Devotion
Review: Gurudwara Sis Ganj Sahib is such beautiful place in such a chaotic street. Main temple is so beautiful and its kitchen is very good and all the accommodation as service to human kind is such a suburb. O always love going to this Temple and sit there for Piece while lestioning beautiful words of Gurbani.

Name: Abhimanyu
Title: crowded yet so serene and calm
Review: it is a gurudwara situated among the bustle of chandni chowk yet it is so serene and calm. the langar food is awesome and the place gives calm and serene. do visit if you visit chandni chowk.

Name: Navin S
Title: Symbol of sacrifice
Review: Gurudwara Sis Ganj, the symbol of sacrifice. Morning is the best time to visit. Sit there for a while. You will feel the vibes. It's a holy place for Sikh community. We feel a calmness here, You can not see any other place. We should must visit once in our lifetime. Guru da langer is very tasty. I love this place.

Name: sukhbirkhalsa9
Title: Religious place
Review: A very religious and sacred place on the land of Delhi near to Red Fort and Jama Masjid a very very good place to roam and enjoy

Name: aashnaalagh
Title: Historical place
Review: Located in chandni chowk ,this gurdwara.entering Gods house is what its like.I feel completely blessed when I visit this place. This place easily accessible via metro but its quit crowed

Name: thefoodsiyappa
Title: siyappa at sis ganj sahib
Review: Whenever I visit chandni chowk, visiting the gurudwara is mandatory. This place gives me peace and happiness from inside.

Name: Twelve-man
Title: IT'S A WAY OF LIFE
Review: One needs to cover ones head ( Not with a baseball cap ) the Temple is beautiful both inside and outPeople are fed free of charge there all sat on the floor in a large room ( yes I know it will have a name other than large room, and that I am showing my Ignorance ) ( For which I apologize ) One is able to walk around the kitchen and help with the preparation of the aforesaid foods.

Name: Jagmeet S
Title: OASIS IN CHANDNI CHOWK
Review: Amidst the chaos of Chandni Chowk and a short walk from Red Fort s this famous historic Sikh shrine.Anybody is welcome as long as they cover their head and walk in barefoot. ( Free head coverings and storage for your footwear is provided. )Really awe inspiring and full of devotion.Sit quietly and feel the sense of peace come over you.

Name: shanupce137
Title: Religious place...
Review: It is situated in Chandni chowk. It is very religious place of our Sikh brothers. So my friend told me to visit this place with him. It is very clean and peaceful place. We take some parsadi also. Very beautiful place.

Name: Lara Sanchez
Title: Welcoming place in Chandni Chowk
Review: This place is a beautiful oasis among Chandni Chowk. You'll need to cover your head to enter (in the information point on the left to the entrance they provide with free scarfs in case you need one). To enter you'll need to be barefoot and wash your feet at the entrance. Entrance is free but donations welcome.
